org.jppf.node.protocol

Interface ClassPathElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassPathElementImpl

    public interface ClassPathElement
extends Serializable
    Instances of this class represent classpath elements that can be added dynamically to a JPPF class loader. The actual classpath element is a jar or zip file wrapped into, or pointed to by, a Location object. They are intended to be transported along with a job SLA.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Location<?> getLocalLocation()
      Get the location of this element, pointing to or embedding the underlying jar or zip file in the client environment.
      String getName()
      Get the name of this classpath element.
      Location<?> getRemoteLocation()
      Get the location of this element, pointing to or embedding the underlying jar or zip file in the node environment.
      boolean validate()
      Perform a validation of this classpath element.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the name of this classpath element.
        Returns:
        the name as a string.

      • getLocalLocation

        Location<?> getLocalLocation()
        Get the location of this element, pointing to or embedding the underlying jar or zip file in the client environment.
        Returns:
        a Location object.

      • getRemoteLocation

        Location<?> getRemoteLocation()
        Get the location of this element, pointing to or embedding the underlying jar or zip file in the node environment.
        Returns:
        a Location object.

      • validate

        boolean validate()
        Perform a validation of this classpath element. If validation fails, if will not be added to the node's classpath and its classes will not be loaded nor executed.

        An example use is to check that a jar file is signed and that it is secure to use it.

        Returns:
        true if the validation issuccessful, false if it fails.
